title: Systems Approach-Based Mathematics Courseware Design and Development: Equation·Statistics·Graph Utilization Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (secondary education level) and foundational knowledge of equations, statistics, and graphs. Additionally, experience with functions, probability distributions, and data visualization tools is required
context.additional_context: Strengthening competencies in developing smartphone-optimized math learning content: includes computational efficiency (matrix operation optimization), visual representation (3D graph rendering), and real-world applications (financial modeling, engineering optimization). Learning activities incorporate UX design and responsive design principles.

learning_goals: Applying systems approach theory, learners systematically analyze ≥3 hierarchical math learning objectives (e.g., polynomial equation solving, multivariate statistics, nonlinear graph interpretation).

Learners complete ADDIE model phase-specific deliverables (e.g., learner needs report in analysis, math concept storyboard draft in design) with ≥90% completeness and earn “excellent” ratings in ≥3 of 4 evaluation criteria (calculation accuracy, problem-solving strategy, visual representation, real-world applicability) from peer/expert reviews.
Design ≥5 smartphone-friendly interactive math learning activities (e.g., conditional probability simulations, higher-degree equation-solving games, dynamic statistical graph generators).

Within 6 months, learners design 3 formative assessment tools tailored to math-based corporate roles (e.g., diagnostic tests, simulation tasks, feedback surveys) and report quantitative learning effectiveness data (e.g., 20% higher problem-solving accuracy, 15% faster calculations, 25% improved graph interpretation).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
